intro: Laserpitium nestleri var. subbeticum, commonly known as the Beticum larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone-rich soils in mountainous regions. It has slender, upright stems with palmately divided leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
